Modifying a Server Configuration

The first time you start a new server configuration, the Server automatically adds the server configuration options, with their default values, to the database. Be sure to review these options, as you may wish to change the default settings. Note that TCP/IP (Sockets) is the only available protocol.

To review and modify a server configuration:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. If the server configuration is not already running, start it. See Starting and Stopping a Server Configuration.

  3. If the new configuration does not appear on the list shown in the left pane, go to Step 5. If the new server configuration appears in the list, go to Step 7.

  4. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Add Server icon.

    • Select Server > Add Server from the menu.

    These actions display the Add Server dialog.

  5. On the Add Server dialog:

    1. Enter the server name in the Server description text box.

    2. Enter the machine name or IP address of the server in the Server address text box.

    3. Enter the correct TCP/IP endpoint information.

    4. (Optional) Select the Compress Transferred Data check box if you wish to compress data transferred between your computer and the server configuration.

    5. (Optional) Select an Encryption Level if you want to protect data transferred between your computer and the server configuration from being read by unauthorized parties over unsecured network lines. The encryption types are ordered (top to bottom) based on speed. Each encryption level is slower, but safer, than the type above it.

  6. When you are done, click OK. This action returns you to the Server Administration dialog, which now lists the new server configuration.

  7. Select the new server configuration.

  8. Log on by entering your User name and administrator's Password. Then click OK.

  9. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Configure Server shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Administration > Configure Server.

      • These actions display the Configure Server dialog. It has eight tabs: General, Audits, Database, Verify Native-I Vault (if you have Native-I files), Protocol, Event Handlers, Directory Services, and Diagnostics. From this dialog, you can review, add, or change server configuration information. See Viewing Server Configuration Options for details on the available choices.

  10. When you finish reviewing and modifying the server configuration information, click OK. The server must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

  11. From the menu of the Server Administration dialog, click Actions > Shut Down Server to display the Server Shut Down dialog.

  12. On the Server Shut Down dialog, select Shutdown and Restart Selected Server.
